creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
[6] (number of the pieces in the series)
Yakamochi\'s poem:
(A passage at the palace
Which is as grace as the Milky Way
Looks so pale because it\'s frosted
That\'s how I realise
How deep the night falls)
{Kasasagi no
Wataseru hashi ni
Oku shimo no
Shiroki wo mireba 
Yo zo fuke ni keri}
; a detailed explanation of the poem follows
markings: artist\'s ? seal; right margin: red collector seal: [AM]
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Illustrations of the Hundred Poems by the Hundred Poets (Hyakunin isshu no uchi)
title: Illustration of the Chūnagon Yakamochi's poem
